title: Warm up and Unwind This Winter on Sri Lanka's Paradise Coast
text:
Warm up and Unwind This Winter on Sri Lanka's Paradise Coast Warm up and Unwind This Winter on Sri Lanka's Paradise Coast 0 
Warm up those winter blues with an escape to Sri Lanka, on the edge of paradise. With its golden sandy beaches, aqua blue sea and serene sunshine, Sri Lanka has been described by the National Geographic as having the best beaches in the world. Boosting the surfing capital of the world, the highest density of leopards in the world, Famed for it natural healing medicines and therapies, famed for happy people, world famous festivals of colour,light and sound, including The Grand Pageant of Asia and the eighth wonder of the world, it really does have every essence of pure bliss. 
Sri Lanka alsoknown as 'Calm India', is a tropical island that lies on the South Eastern tip of India, approximately the size of Ireland. There's a fine choice of trips to delight any budding traveller from rich culture to picturesque golden beaches, safari parks and magnificent landscapes. Whatever you decide you will experience some of the most beautiful and fascinating sights, culture and people in the world, like nothing you've ever seen before. 
Sri Lanka is one of the top wildlife capitals of the world, if you are a wildlife enthusiast, you will find 91 species of mammals, including Asian elephants, sloth bear, leopards, samba and wild buffaloes. Yet the rarest mammals including red slender Loris, Toque Macaque and Purple-faced Langur. The Sri Lankanocean is home to an abundance of sealife, including the mighty blue whales, sperm whales and animateddolphins. This piece of paradise is one of the best locations for whale and dolphin watching. If you look to the skies you'll enjoy some of the 433 bird species of which 233 are resident to Sri Lanka and 80 species have developed a distinct Sri Lankan race, compared to their cousins in mainland India. 
The East and West coast offers long stretches or picturesque golden sandy beaches and the South coast offers pretty idyllic bays and coves. The summer monsoon can affect the South coast, so best visited in the winter, where as the North Coast is affected by the winter monsoon so best visited in the summer.
